page.title: 11LOCAL HISTORY, FROG HALL
page.content: LOCAL HISTORY; FROG HALL. So called because of the hemp pits which are here, the hemp pits were the breeding place for frogs and toads. When the garden was devolped it incorporated a fairly large rockery pond which has since been adopted by the frogs and toads as their breeding place. Each year they return in there hundreds to perform their short courtship and mating rituals, departing afterwards as swiftly as they come. The area which accommodated the original hemps has been turned into padocks.
